data.title: Charles Martin-Lecamp - Men's Tennis
data.meta_description: Charles Martin-Lecamp - At Charlotte - 2010-2011: First-Team All-Atlantic 10... Won 14 singles and 14 doubles matches... Took 10 of Charlotte's 11 number-one singles
data.text:
At Charlotte - 2010-2011: First-Team All-Atlantic 10... Won 14 singles and 14 doubles matches... Took 10 of Charlotte's 11 number-one singles victories... Finished 2-2 at A-10 Championships... Partnered with senior Moritz Bernhoerster to win six number-one and six number-two doubles wins, the most at each spot by any pair this season... That tandem was a team-best 14-8 together... Pair was 3-1 at A-10 Championships... He had seven losses with four other partners... Dean's List (fall), Chancellor's List (spring).

2009-2010: First-Team All-Atlantic 10... Led all players with 15 singles victories, including seven wins at number two... Seven tournament wins in the fall, including a season-best five straight, paced the squad... Had 10 doubles wins, with seven coming in at number three with partner Anthony Davison... Won three consecutive doubles matches twice during the season... Recorded 1-0 mark in doubles, with three unfinished matches at Atlantic 10 Conference Championships... Dean's List (Fall and Spring)

2008-09: Finished 16-12 in singles play, with a 7-4 record at number four and a 4-2 mark at number five... Team-best 13 wins (13-8) in the spring match season... One of two players to log a win at No. 20 North Carolina on January 25, as he won 6-3, 6-4 at number six... Strung together nine-match win streak in long home stand from March 7 to April 4... Won all three conference singles matches in that stretch... Was 3-4 in three-set matches, with one match unfinished... Was 1-1 at 2009 Atlantic 10 Championships... Was 4-8 in doubles play, with three different partners.

Prep - Was 22-8 on clay courts, 6-6 on hard courts. Lost in the semi-finals of the Paris Junior Championship, defeating two of the Top 20 players in the French juniors.

Personal - Son of Brigitte Lecamp and Dominique Martin. Has a brother, Gonzague. Major is economics... Born March 22.
